In context of PCA, the singular vectors are referred to as principal components, and the decomposition is known as principal component analysis. Note that the singular vector $u_1$ corresponds to the largest singular value $\sigma_1$. That is why $u_1$ is the vector picturing feature of the largest variance. The only key difference compared to the SVD is the centring of the data, i.e. we subtract the mean of the columns of the data matrix. For the probabilistic PCA implamantation via eigendecomposition of covariance or correlation matrix, look here .
